page.title: 16Clubs
page.content: Entertainment which is common in urban areas is not to be found in our area, so it is left to local people to form their own clubs and other organisations, which become a way of life vital to the existence of the village as well as individuals. There are a number of youth organisations such as Young Farmers, a youth club, playgroup, cubs, brownies and girl guides. The women have a Mother's Union and a Women's Institute. The men have Freemasons, the Ante-diluvian Order of Buffaloes, a cricket club, and in winter a football club and darts team. These sports clubs, along with the bowls and croquet club have extensive use of the recreation ground. There is a Parish Council, Church Council, Stage Society, Dancing Club, Walking Club, Wednesday Club, Esthwaite Fellowship and Yoga.
